narrative.title: 1St Armoured Division - 1943Q2
narrative.situation: British Armoured Division deployed in North Africa during 1943Q2.
narrative.objectives: Mobile armoured warfare - breakthrough and exploitation operations in Tunisia Campaign. Division transitioned from Eighth Army (pursuit from Libya) to First Army (northern Tunisia offensive) in April 1943.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Northern Tunisia: Mixed terrain - coastal plains, hills, agricultural valleys. Division fought at Wadi Akarit (April 6-7), El Kourzia hills (April 22-26), final advance to Tunis through mixed terrain (May 8-13). Post-battle: Tunisia garrison/coastal areas.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Combined arms armoured warfare (armoured brigade + motor brigade coordination)
Coordinated artillery support with three field regiments
Experienced in desert warfare (El Alamein veterans)

environment.terrain_type: Northern Tunisia: Mixed terrain - coastal plains, hills, agricultural valleys. Division fought at Wadi Akarit (April 6-7), El Kourzia hills (April 22-26), final advance to Tunis through mixed terrain (May 8-13). Post-battle: Tunisia garrison/coastal areas.
